questions.question_text: Which CLI command should an administrator use on FortiGate to view the RSSO authentication process in real time?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. While fnbamd has to do with authentication, radiusd is specifically about RSSO. Page 131 of the study guide.

Selected Answer: A
A is correct.
https://fortinetweb.s3.amazonaws.com/docs.fortinet.com/v2/attachments/5f000f73-5419-11ee-8e6d-fa163e15d75b/FortiOS-7.4-Troubleshooting_Cheat_Sheet.pdf

Selected Answer: BCD
p 130 and 137 of user guide explain the use of radius.
BCD are correct

Selected Answer: BCD
B, C & D

comments.content: diagnose test application radiusd command exists (Study Guide p.130) but not for radius server configuration, user credentials or user group membership.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BCD
E: there's no command 'radiusd'

choices.D: You can enable debug for the fnbamd process to view RADIUS authentication details.
choices.B: You can use the diagnose test authserver radius command to verify RADIUS server configuration, user credentials, and user group membership.
choices.C: You can check the Firewall Users widget to view the list of active RADIUS users.
choices.E: You can use the diagnose test application radiusd command to verify the RADIUS server configuration, user credentials, and user group membership.
choices.A: You can enable debug for the fssod process to view RADIUS authentication details.

questions.question_text: Which three FortiOS tools can you use to troubleshoot RADIUS authentication issues? (Choose three.)

Refer to the exhibit.

//IMG//


Examine the IPsec VPN phase 1 configuration shown in the exhibit.

An administrator wants to use certificate-based authentication for an IPsec VPN user.

Which three configuration changes must you make on FortiGate to perform certificate-based authentication for the IPsec VPN user? (Choose three.)

choices.A: Create a PKI user for the IPsec VPN user, and then configure the IPsec VPN tunnel to accept the PKI user as peer certificate.
choices.D: Enable XAUTH on the IPsec VPN tunnel.
choices.C: Import the CA that signed the user certificate.
choices.E: In the Authentication section of the IPsec VPN tunnel, in the Method drop-down list, select Signature, and then select the certificate that FortiGate will use for IPsec VPN.
choices.B: In the IKE section of the IPsec VPN tunnel, in the Mode field, select Main (ID protection).

comments.content: D. is incorrect, as XAUTH should specifically be disabled.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CDE
CDE are true.

questions.question_text: Which statement correctly describes the guest portal behavior on FortiAuthenticator?

choices.A: All self-registered and sponsored accounts are listed on the local Users GUI page on FortiAuthenticator.
choices.C: Sponsored accounts cannot authenticate using guest portals.
choices.D: All guest accounts must be activated using SMS or email activation codes.
choices.B: FortiAuthenticator uses POST parameters and a RADIUS client configuration to map the request to a guest portal for authentication.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Study Guide p.372

choices.C: Enable multiple channels in the Channels section and enable Radio Resource Provision.
choices.A: In the SSIDs section, enable Tunnel.
choices.B: Enable one channel in the Channels section.
choices.D: In the SSIDs section, enable Manual and assign the networks manually.

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit.
//IMG//

The exhibits show the wireless network (VAP) SSID profiles defined on FortiManager and an AP profile assigned to a group of APs that are supported by FortiGate.
None of the APs are broadcasting the SSIDs defined by the AP profile.
Which changes do you need to make to enable the SSIDs to broadcast?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is correct. B is not correct because, if any channel it was not selected the AP will use all available channels.

Selected Answer: D
would claim "D" as per study guide p. 329
A should be the correct answer

Selected Answer: B
According to the FortiManager Administration Guide1, ''To enable the SSID, you must select at least one channel for the radio. If no channels are selected, the SSID will not be enabled.'' Therefore, enabling one
channel in the Channels section will allow the SSIDs to broadcast.
